description.text:
UKRI is currently consulting on the future development of its open access policy, including the inclusion of monographs, edited collections and book chapters into the policy scope. The changes under consultation will affect all UKRI funded researchers. Particular areas that may be of interest are: funding for open access books, licensing requirements and embargo periods.
We invite researchers at all levels (including PGRs) to discuss the consultation, ask questions and provide feedback at an online forum. The feedback you provide will shape our institutional response to UKRI. 
The forum will be held via Blackboard Collaborate, and the link will be circulated to attendees prior to the event. The full consultation document can be found here, and it may be useful for you to read these frequently asked questions which are based on feedback we have already received. The forum will be structured around the issues raised in these FAQs, but we are happy to discuss any other questions or concerns you may have.
If you are unable to attend the forum, please leave your feedback here, or email fiona.chislett@sheffield.ac.uk.

UKRI is currently consulting on the future development of its open access policy, including the inclusion of monographs, edited collections and book chapters into the policy scope. The changes under consultation will affect all UKRI funded researchers. Particular areas that may be of interest are: funding for open access books, licensing requirements and embargo periods.

We invite researchers at all levels (including PGRs) to discuss the consultation, ask questions and provide feedback at an online forum. The feedback you provide will shape our institutional response to UKRI. 

The forum will be held via Blackboard Collaborate, and the link will be circulated to attendees prior to the event. The full consultation document can be found here, and it may be useful for you to read these frequently asked questions which are based on feedback we have already received. The forum will be structured around the issues raised in these FAQs, but we are happy to discuss any other questions or concerns you may have.

If you are unable to attend the forum, please leave your feedback here, or email fiona.chislett@sheffield.ac.uk.

frontmatter.title: Try something new!
frontmatter.description: As part of ORDA, we've developed a data visualisation showcase site where researchers are able to host interactive data visualisations and also link them to reposited data in ORDA.
